holidays.name: Send a Card to a Friend Day
holidays.description: A delightful day encouraging you to brighten a friend's day by sending them a handwritten card or postcard. In the age of texts and emails, this day revives the warmth of snail mail surprises!
holidays.origin: The exact origin is unknown, but it gained popularity through social media as a way to nurture personal connections.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that receiving a handwritten card can boost happiness and feelings of appreciation more than digital messages!

holidays.origin: This unofficial and playful holiday emerged on social platforms as a humorous way to spread friendliness and fun.
holidays.funFact: Waving with all fingers at once is recognized globally as a welcoming gesture, but dedicating a whole day makes it extra silly and memorable.

holidays.name: National Fettuccine Alfredo Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the creamy, cheesy goodness of Fettuccine Alfredo ‚Äî the beloved Italian pasta dish made with butter, heavy cream, and Parmesan cheese.
holidays.origin: Though the dish dates back to early 20th century Rome, this food holiday was popularized in the U.S. to honor the creamy pasta classic.
holidays.funFact: Fettuccine Alfredo was created by Alfredo di Lelio in Rome to help his wife regain her appetite during pregnancy, making it a comforting, loving recipe!
